Lebanese President on Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Lebanese President Emile Lahoud said that Lebanon and the DPRK have long developed the friendly relations and supported and cooperated with each other on the international arena, adding that Lebanon is pleased with this.
 Kim Pyong Nam, new DPRK ambassador to Lebanon, presented his credentials to the president on April 2

articles.title: China to Donate Emergency Relief Goods to DPRK
KPA to Take Necessary Measure against U.S. Unilateral Action
articles.content:
China to Donate Emergency Relief Goods to DPRK 
    Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The Chinese government decided to donate emergency relief goods worth 10 million Renminbi Yuan to the DPRK in connection with the wagon explosion that occurred due to carelessness at Ryongchon Railway Station, North Phyongan Province on April 22.
 The delivery of the relief goods to the spot will start on Sunday.    
 Governments of many other countries and international bodies and organizations have expressed their willingness to provide humanitarian aid.

articles.title: Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from Pakistani President
Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from Syrian President
articles.content:
Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from Pakistani President 
    Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Saturday received a message of sympathy from Pervez Musharraf, president of Pakistan.
 The message says he could hardly repress deep sorrow upon hearing the news that a heavy toll of human lives was taken by a train accident in the DPRK and this big loss of lives is a very unfortunate and sad thing.    
 In the name of the Pakistani government and people and in my own name, I express deep condolences to the DPRK government and people and profound sympathy to the bereaved families, the message says.

articles.title: Sympathy from Russian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Kim Jong Il from Syrian President
    Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of sympathy from Syrian President Bashar Al Assad Saturday.
 The Syrian president in the message says he heard with deep sorrow the news that dozens of friendly Korean people were killed and tens of others wounded in a railway accident in the DPRK.    
 He, in the name of the Syrian Arab people and in his own name, extended sincerest condolences to Kim Jong Il and the victims to the accident and wished the wounded an early recovery, the message noted.

articles.title: S. Korean Delegation Visits Different Places
articles.content:
Sympathy from Russian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov Saturday sent a message of sympathy to his DPRK counterpart Paek Nam Sun.
 The message expressed deep condolences to him as regards the railway accident that claimed huge casualties and sincere sympathy to the bereaved families and relatives.
